of hospitalization is considered indicative of possible bacterial infection. LRTIs are a frequent cause of hospitalization and a major reason for treatment with antibiotics worldwide. the role of respiratory viruses in LRTIs in older adults is increasingly recognized, suggesting that accurate diagnostic tests to identify the etiologic mechanism of LRTIs have the potential to reduce overall antibiotic use. the 10 classifier genes have superior sensitivity and similar specificity compared with serum PCT. these findings are in accord with the Infectious Diseases Society of America/American Thoracic Society recommendations for improvement in the diagnosis of LRTI. the biosignatures were obtained from hospitalized patients who represent the most severe forms of LRTI. this important subgroup will require further studies using a larger sample. there are ongoing studies applying PCR-based platforms to advance the implementation of host transcriptional profiles in the clinical setting.
